instructions.text: In a large mixer or food processor, place flour, salt, sugar, and ghee and mix for 10 seconds.
instructions.note: It is crucial that none of the ingredients are warm enough to melt the butter. The resulting mixture appears sandy. On warm days, chill flour for 30 minutes before using.

instructions.text: Cut the butter into small chunks and add to the mixture. Pulse in 1-second increments until the butter is pea-sized.
instructions.note: Typically 3 pulses, a gentle mix with a fork, then another pulse.

instructions.text: Turn the mixture into a mixing bowl and add water in 4 to 5 additions, mixing with a fork after each addition.
instructions.note: Don't knead the dough. Instead use a scraper to gently press it together.

instructions.text: Move the dough onto plastic wrap, wrap tightly, and chill for 2 hours before rolling.
Cut the chilled dough into two pieces, lightly flour, and roll out one piece at a time.
Quarter turn and roll to keep a round shape; press and repair any edge cracks as you go.
Roll the dough at least 4 inches larger than the pie pan.
Place the dough in the pie pan, patch any cracks, and return to the fridge while you prepare the filling.
Prepare your filling and let it cool completely before filling the crust.
If making a double crust, trim and cut ventilation holes in the top dough, then crimp the edges.
instructions.note: Edges may bake thick but will be super flaky.
We've never had a soggy bottom when the crust is cold at assembly.
